news.title: Anchovies eat plastic because it smells like prey
news.summary: August 16, 2017 by Matthew Savoca, The Conversation As you bite into a delicious piece of fish, you probably don't think about what the fish itself ate – but perhaps you should.

news.title: America's Messy History of Medical Experiments Started With Slaves
news.summary: By Londa Schiebinger, Stanford University In the natural course of events, humans fall sick and die.

news.title: Medical experimentation on slaves in 18th-century Caribbean colonies | Stanford News
news.summary: In her new book, Stanford historian Londa Schiebinger examines the development of medical knowledge and the experiments conducted on slaves in British and French colonies between the 1760s and the early 1800s.
